member.name: M:Spotify.WebApi.Apis.Album.IAlbumApi.GetAlbumAsync(Spotify.WebApi.Model.SpotifyUri,System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for a single album.
member.param: Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:Spotify.WebApi.Apis.Album.IAlbumApi.GetAlbumAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for a single album.
member.param: The Spotify Id for the album.

member.name: M:Spotify.WebApi.Apis.Album.IAlbumApi.GetAlbumsTrackAsync(Spotify.WebApi.Model.SpotifyUri,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information about an album’s tracks. Optional parameters can be used to limit the number of tracks returned.
member.param: Optional. The maximum number of tracks to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
Optional. The index of the first track to return. Default: 0 (the first object). Use with limit to get the next set of tracks.
Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:Spotify.WebApi.Apis.Album.IAlbumApi.GetAlbumsTrackAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information about an album’s tracks. Optional parameters can be used to limit the number of tracks returned.
member.param: The Spotify Id for the album.
Optional. The maximum number of tracks to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
Optional. The index of the first track to return. Default: 0 (the first object). Use with limit to get the next set of tracks.
Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:Spotify.WebApi.Apis.Album.IAlbumApi.GetAlbumsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{Spotify.WebApi.Model.SpotifyUri},System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for multiple albums identified by their Spotify IDs.
member.param: Required. A list of for the albums. Maximum: 20 IDs.
Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:Spotify.WebApi.Apis.Album.IAlbumApi.GetAlbumsAsync(System.String[])
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for multiple albums identified by their Spotify IDs.
member.param: Required. A list of Spotify Ids for the albums. Maximum: 20 IDs.

member.name: M:Spotify.WebApi.Apis.Album.IAlbumApi.GetAlbumsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for multiple albums identified by their Spotify IDs.
member.param: Required. A list oof Spotify Ids for the albums. Maximum: 20 IDs.
Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album
member.summary: An album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.AlbumType
member.summary: The type of the album: album, single, or compilation.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Artists
member.summary: The artists of the album. Each artist object includes a link in href to more detailed information about the artist.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.AvailableMarkets
member.summary: The markets in which the album is available: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes. Note that an album is considered available in a market when at least 1 of its tracks is available in that market.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Copyrights
member.summary: The copyright statements of the album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.ExternalIds
member.summary: Known external IDs for the album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.ExternalUrls
member.summary: Known external URLs for this album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Genres
member.summary: A list of the genres used to classify the album. For example: “Prog Rock” , “Post-Grunge”. (If not yet classified, the array is empty.)

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Href
member.summary: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Id
member.summary: The Spotify ID for the album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Images
member.summary: The cover art for the album in various sizes, widest first.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Label
member.summary: The label for the album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Name
member.summary: The name of the album. In case of an album takedown, the value may be an empty string.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Popularity
member.summary: The popularity of the album. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The popularity is calculated from the popularity of the album’s individual tracks.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.ReleaseDate
member.summary: The date the album was first released, for example “1981-12-15”. Depending on the precision, it might be shown as “1981” or “1981-12”.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.ReleaseDatePrecision
member.summary: The precision with which release_date value is known: “year” , “month” , or “day”.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Tracks
member.summary: The tracks of the album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Type
member.summary: The object type: “album”

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.Album.Uri
member.summary: The Spotify URI for the album.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.MultipleAlbums
member.summary: Internal class for wrapping the MultipleAlbums response.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.SavedAlbum
member.summary: A saved album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.SavedAlbum.AddedAt
member.summary: The date and time the album was saved Timestamps are returned in ISO 8601 format as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) with a zero offset: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. If the time is imprecise (for example, the date/time of an album release), an additional field indicates the precision; see for example, release_date in an album object.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Albums.SavedAlbum.Album
member.summary: Information about the album.

member.summary: Note: This field is deprecated and might be removed in the future. Please use the languages field instead. The language used in the episode, identified by a ISO 639 code.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Episodes.SimpleEpisode.Languages
member.summary: A list of the languages used in the episode, identified by their ISO 639 code.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Episodes.SimpleEpisode.Name
member.summary: The name of the episode.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Episodes.SimpleEpisode.ReleaseDate
member.summary: The date the episode was first released, for example "1981-12-15". Depending on the precision, it might be shown as "1981" or "1981-12".

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Episodes.SimpleEpisode.ReleaseDatePrecision
member.summary: The precision with which release_date value is known: "year", "month", or "day".

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Episodes.SimpleEpisode.ResumePoint
member.summary: The user’s most recent position in the episode. Set if the supplied access token is a user token and has the scope ‘user-read-playback-position’.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Episodes.SimpleEpisode.Type
member.summary: The object type: “episode”.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Episodes.SimpleEpisode.Uri
member.summary: The Spotify URI for the episode.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Paging`1.Items

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Paging`1.Limit
member.summary: The maximum number of items in the response (as set in the query or by default).

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Paging`1.Next
member.summary: URL to the next page of items. ( null if none)

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Paging`1.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the items returned (as set in the query or by default)

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Paging`1.Previous
member.summary: URL to the previous page of items. ( null if none)

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Paging`1.Total
member.summary: The total number of items available to return.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.CurrentlyPlaying
member.summary: A currently playing class.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.CurrentlyPlaying.Context
member.summary: A Context Object. Can be null.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.CurrentlyPlaying.CurrentlyPlayingType
member.summary: The object type of the currently playing item. Can be one of track, episode, ad or unknown.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.CurrentlyPlaying.IsPlaying
member.summary: If something is currently playing, return true.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.CurrentlyPlaying.Item
member.summary: The currently playing track or episode. Can be null.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.CurrentlyPlaying.ProgressMs
member.summary: Progress into the currently playing track or episode. Can be null.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.CurrentlyPlaying.Timestamp
member.summary: Unix Millisecond Timestamp when data was fetched

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.Device
member.summary: A device.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.Device.Id
member.summary: The device ID. This may be null.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.Device.IsActive
member.summary: If this device is the currently active device.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.Device.IsPrivateSession
member.summary: If this device is currently in a private session.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.Device.IsRestricted
member.summary: Whether controlling this device is restricted. At present if this is “true” then no Web API commands will be accepted by this device.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.Device.Name
member.summary: The name of the device.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.Device.Type
member.summary: Device type, such as “computer”, “smartphone” or “speaker”.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.Device.VolumePercent
member.summary: The current volume in percent. This may be null.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playback.PlayHistory
member.summary: The play history.

member.summary: The context the track was played from.

member.summary: The date and time the track was played.

member.summary: A playlist.

member.summary: true if the owner allows other users to modify the playlist.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.ExternalUrls
member.summary: Known external URLs for this playlist.

member.summary: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the playlist.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.Id
member.summary: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.Images
member.summary: Images for the playlist. The array may be empty or contain up to three images. The images are returned by size in descending order. See Working with Playlists. Note: If returned, the source URL for the image (url) is temporary and will expire in less than a day.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.Name
member.summary: The name of the playlist.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.Owner
member.summary: The user who owns the playlist

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.Public
member.summary: The playlist’s public/private status: true the playlist is public, false the playlist is private, null the playlist status is not relevant. For more about public/private status, see Working with Playlists

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.SnapshotId
member.summary: The version identifier for the current playlist. Can be supplied in other requests to target a specific playlist version

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.Tracks
member.summary: A collection containing a link (href) to the Web API endpoint where full details of the playlist’s tracks can be retrieved, along with the total number of items in the playlist.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.Type
member.summary: The object type: “playlist”

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Playlists.Playlist.Uri
member.summary: The Spotify URI for the playlist.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationSeed

member.summary: The number of tracks available after min_* and max_* filters have been applied.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationSeed.AfterRelinkingSize
member.summary: The number of tracks available after relinking for regional availability.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationSeed.Href
member.summary: A link to the full track or artist data for this seed. For tracks this will be a link to a Track Object. For artists a link to an Artist Object. For genre seeds, this value will be null.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationSeed.Id
member.summary: The id used to select this seed. This will be the same as the string used in the seed_artists, seed_tracks or seed_genres parameter.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationSeed.InitialPoolSize
member.summary: The number of recommended tracks available for this seed.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationSeed.Type
member.summary: The entity type of this seed. One of artist, track or genre.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationsResponse
member.summary: Recommendations response.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationsResponse.Seeds
member.summary: An array of recommendation seed objects.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.RecommendationsResponse.Tracks
member.summary: An array of track object (simplified) ordered according to the parameters supplied.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Shows.SavedShow
member.summary: A saved show.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Shows.SavedShow.AddedAt
member.summary: The date and time the show was saved. Timestamps are returned in ISO 8601 format as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) with a zero offset: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. If the time is imprecise (for example, the date/time of an album release), an additional field indicates the precision; see for example, release_date in an album object.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures
member.summary: Audio features class.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Acousticness
member.summary: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.AnalysisUrl
member.summary: An HTTP URL to access the full audio analysis of this track. An access token is required to access this data.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Danceability
member.summary: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.DurationMs
member.summary: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Energy
member.summary: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy. For example, death metal has high energy, while a Bach prelude scores low on the scale. Perceptual features contributing to this attribute include dynamic range, perceived loudness, timbre, onset rate, and general entropy.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Id
member.summary: The Spotify ID for the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Instrumentalness
member.summary: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. “Ooh” and “aah” sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly “vocal”. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Key
member.summary: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation . E.g. 0 = C, 1 = C♯/D♭, 2 = D, and so on.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Liveness
member.summary: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Loudness
member.summary: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Mode
member.summary: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Speechiness
member.summary: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value. Values above 0.66 describe tracks that are probably made entirely of spoken words. Values between 0.33 and 0.66 describe tracks that may contain both music and speech, either in sections or layered, including such cases as rap music. Values below 0.33 most likely represent music and other non-speech-like tracks.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Tempo
member.summary: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM). In musical terminology, tempo is the speed or pace of a given piece and derives directly from the average beat duration.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.TimeSignature
member.summary: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure).

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.TrackHref
member.summary: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Type
member.summary: The object type: “audio_features”

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Uri
member.summary: The Spotify URI for the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.AudioFeatures.Valence
member.summary: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track. Tracks with high valence sound more positive (e.g. happy, cheerful, euphoric), while tracks with low valence sound more negative (e.g. sad, depressed, angry).

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.LinkedTrack
member.summary: Linked track class.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.LinkedTrack.Type
member.summary: The object type, "track", "episode", etc.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.LinkedTrack.Uri
member.summary: The Spotify URI for the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.LinkedTrack.Href
member.summary: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track/episode.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.LinkedTrack.Id
member.summary: The Spotify ID for the track/episode.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.LinkedTrack.ExternalUrls
member.summary: Known external URLs for this track.

member.summary: Base class for playable objects.

member.summary: The name of the track or episode.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.PlaylistTrack
member.summary: A playlist track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.PlaylistTrack.AddedAt
member.summary: The date and time the track or episode was added. Note that some very old playlists may return null in this field.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.PlaylistTrack.AddedBy
member.summary: The Spotify user who added the track or episode. Note that some very old playlists may return null in this field.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.PlaylistTrack.IsLocal
member.summary: Whether this track or episode is a local file or not.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.PlaylistTrack.Track
member.summary: Information about the track or episode.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SavedTrack
member.summary: A saved track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SavedTrack.AddedAt
member.summary: The date and time the track was saved. Timestamps are returned in ISO 8601 format as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) with a zero offset: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. If the time is imprecise (for example, the date/time of an album release), an additional field indicates the precision; see for example, release_date in an album object.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SavedTrack.Track
member.summary: Information about the track.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack
member.summary: A simplified track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.Artists
member.summary: The artists who performed the track. Each artist object includes a link in href to more detailed information about the artist.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.AvailableMarkets
member.summary: A list of the countries in which the track can be played, identified by their ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.DiscNumber
member.summary: The disc number (usually 1 unless the album consists of more than one disc).

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.DurationMs
member.summary: The track length in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.Explicit
member.summary: Whether or not the track has explicit lyrics ( true = yes it does; false = no it does not OR unknown).

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.ExternalUrls
member.summary: External URLs for this track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.Href
member.summary: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.Id
member.summary: The Spotify ID for the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.IsPlayable
member.summary: Part of the response when Track Relinking is applied. If true , the track is playable in the given market. Otherwise false.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.LinkedFrom
member.summary: Part of the response when Track Relinking is applied and is only part of the response if the track linking, in fact, exists. The requested track has been replaced with a different track. The track in the linked_from object contains information about the originally requested track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.Name
member.summary: The name of the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.PreviewUrl
member.summary: A URL to a 30 second preview (MP3 format) of the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.TrackNumber
member.summary: The number of the track. If an album has several discs, the track number is the number on the specified disc.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.Type
member.summary: The object type: “track”.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.SimpleTrack.Uri
member.summary: The Spotify URI for the track.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track
member.summary: A track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.Album
member.summary: The album on which the track appears. The album object includes a link in href to full information about the album.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.Artists
member.summary: The artists who performed the track. Each artist object includes a link in href to more detailed information about the artist.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.AvailableMarkets
member.summary: A list of the countries in which the track can be played, identified by their ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.DiscNumber
member.summary: The disc number (usually 1 unless the album consists of more than one disc).

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.DurationMs
member.summary: The track length in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.Explicit
member.summary: Whether or not the track has explicit lyrics ( true = yes it does; false = no it does not OR unknown).

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.ExternalIds
member.summary: Known external IDs for the track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.IsPlayable
member.summary: Part of the response when Track Relinking is applied. If true , the track is playable in the given market. Otherwise false.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.LinkedFrom
member.summary: Part of the response when Track Relinking is applied, and the requested track has been replaced with different track. The track in the linked_from object contains information about the originally requested track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.Popularity
member.summary: The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.The popularity of a track is a value between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The popularity is calculated by algorithm and is based, in the most part, on the total number of plays the track has had and how recent those plays are.Generally speaking, songs that are being played a lot now will have a higher popularity than songs that were played a lot in the past. Duplicate tracks (e.g. the same track from a single and an album) are rated independently. Artist and album popularity is derived mathematically from track popularity. Note that the popularity value may lag actual popularity by a few days: the value is not updated in real time.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.PreviewUrl
member.summary: A link to a 30 second preview (MP3 format) of the track. Can be null

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.Restrictions
member.summary: Part of the response when Track Relinking is applied, the original track is not available in the given market, and Spotify did not have any tracks to relink it with. The track response will still contain metadata for the original track, and a restrictions object containing the reason why the track is not available: "restrictions" : {"reason" : "market"}

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.Track.TrackNumber
member.summary: The number of the track. If an album has several discs, the track number is the number on the specified disc.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack
member.summary: A tuneable track.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Acousticness
member.summary: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Danceability
member.summary: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.DurationMs
member.summary: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Energy
member.summary: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy. For example, death metal has high energy, while a Bach prelude scores low on the scale. Perceptual features contributing to this attribute include dynamic range, perceived loudness, timbre, onset rate, and general entropy.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Instrumentalness
member.summary: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. “Ooh” and “aah” sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly “vocal”. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Key
member.summary: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation. E.g. 0 = C, 1 = C♯/D♭, 2 = D, and so on.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Liveness
member.summary: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Loudness
member.summary: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Mode
member.summary: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Popularity
member.summary: The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The popularity is calculated by algorithm and is based, in the most part, on the total number of plays the track has had and how recent those plays are. Note: When applying track relinking via the market parameter, it is expected to find relinked tracks with popularities that do not match min_*, max_*and target_* popularities. These relinked tracks are accurate replacements for unplayable tracks with the expected popularity scores. Original, non-relinked tracks are available via the linked_from attribute of the relinked track response.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Speechiness
member.summary: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value. Values above 0.66 describe tracks that are probably made entirely of spoken words. Values between 0.33 and 0.66 describe tracks that may contain both music and speech, either in sections or layered, including such cases as rap music. Values below 0.33 most likely represent music and other non-speech-like tracks.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Tempo
member.summary: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM). In musical terminology, tempo is the speed or pace of a given piece and derives directly from the average beat duration.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.TimeSignature
member.summary: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure).

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Tracks.TuneableTrack.Valence
member.summary: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track. Tracks with high valence sound more positive (e.g. happy, cheerful, euphoric), while tracks with low valence sound more negative (e.g. sad, depressed, angry).

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.Followers
member.summary: The class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the href.

member.summary: Gets or sets the total.

member.name: T:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser
member.summary: A private user.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser.Country
member.summary: The country of the user, as set in the user’s account profile. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. This field is only available when the current user has granted access to the user-read-private scope.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser.DisplayName
member.summary: The name displayed on the user’s profile. null if not available.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser.Email
member.summary: The user’s email address, as entered by the user when creating their account. Important! This email address is unverified; there is no proof that it actually belongs to the user. This field is only available when the current user has granted access to the user-read-email scope.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser.ExternalUrls
member.summary: Known external URLs for this user.

member.summary: Information about the followers of the user.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser.Href
member.summary: A link to the Web API endpoint for this user.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser.Id
member.summary: The Spotify user ID for the user.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser.Images
member.summary: The user’s profile image.

member.name: P:Spotify.WebApi.Model.Objects.Users.PrivateUser.Product
member.summary: The user’s Spotify subscription level: “premium”, “free”, etc. (The subscription level “open” can be considered the same as “free”.) This field is only available when the current user has granted access to the user-read-private scope.
